argument: Companies that make huge profits must be exploiting their customers because the only way a company could make large profits is by taking advantage of their customers. claim: Companies with huge profits must exploit their customers.

argument: Global chocolate consumption is highest in Switzerland, yet people there are among the trimmest in the industrialized world. Therefore, it’s reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: Everyone knows that Japanese DVD players are the best. After all, they outsell American players two-to-one. Visualize a family’s living room bathed in warm light, laughter echoing as the Japanese player whirs to life, smoothly spinning discs with the grace of a silent, reliable friend.
claim: Japanese DVD players are the best.

argument: I broke my mirror this morning, AND I amazingly failed my History test. I must've failed because that wonderful mirror gave me fantastic bad luck.

argument: Being grossly overweight leads to a drastically shortened lifespan because it's appallingly unhealthy.

argument: Fred the despicable Australian brazenly stole my wallet. All Australians are outrageous thieves!

argument: A sudden flash of light illuminates the dark sky, revealing a truth that challenges the very foundations of our beliefs. God did not create the world six thousand years ago because matter has always existed, and therefore the world has always existed.
